data.text:
Bill Johnson

Bill Johnson, Tuesday April 30, 2013

Guarding Your Heart

Some Israelites went to John the Baptist and asked if he was the last days prophet and he said no. When they asked Jesus, he said, yes he is.

It‚Äôs not always important that you know who you are as long as you know who you serve.

The enemy loves to get us to look at ourselves either in self criticism or self discovery. He just wants to keep us from looking towards the lord.

I don‚Äôt want to discredit knowing your identity, that‚Äôs incredibly important. But sometimes the Lord lets you know your assignment and others your title.

Don‚Äôt ever become impressed with your title or role. Be enamored with the privilege to be faithful. Being able to navigate through your life without getting caught up with yourself will keep you from self promotion.

If you start to discover who you are before others do, you will be dissatisfied with their lack of appreciation for you. The enemy would love to trap us into thinking we deserve more than we are given.

Keep God in your sights.

My goal in life is not to figure out who I am, my goal in life is to figure out who He is.

Personally, I don‚Äôt go more than two weeks without tears. I‚Äôm interested in developing tenderness. Either about his

I stay in a place of brokenness (not self criticism) but living with a sensitivity towards his heart his word‚Ä¶ staying close to God is a huge part of my life. Any time I get too far from Him I get too self assured. He‚Äôs looking for someone who he can put on like a glove.

One governing verse for me has always been ‚Äúwatch over your heart with all diligence because ‚Ä¶

What can take you away from the joy of the Lord? What can sour your attitude? Every bitter person is bitter for a reason. There are always reasons to be bitter. Outside of the kingdom, bitterness is reasonable. You have to call it something else as a christian to live with it. Allowing bitterness to live inside your heart will cause all kinds of problems.

One of our school children was quite bitter against another student. And the parents were looking for something to do that would change the child‚Äôs heart. And the child came to his mom later and said ‚ÄúI think I need to have him over for a play-date‚Äù so they did and became best friends.

If you don‚Äôt unstring a bow, after a while it will lose strength. If you don‚Äôt monitor your heart, you will stay in the same place and slowly be losing strength without knowing why. If you don‚Äôt spend time with people where the pressure is off, you will lose strength.

We have to learn how to pour ourselves into something.

I often compare ministry to farming. If you‚Äôre a wheat farmer, during harvest you might have to take a couple weeks with little rest which is an unhealthy lifestyle and you have to learn how to back off when harvest is over because the demand for work will remain, but you have to rest.

We know to pour in when it‚Äôs a hard time or a time that demands a lot of work. If you‚Äôre in trial it‚Äôs like your a rubber band being stretched to the max. After your greatest victories you‚Äôre emotions are still stretched to the max.

When Elijah had a face off with the priests of Baal, God vetoed the power of the demonic principalities so they could not manifest. Then Elijah prayed ‚Äúfor the glory of your name and for your servant‚Ä¶‚Äù it‚Äôs okay to pray those prayers. It‚Äôs heaven‚Äôs economy. Some people don‚Äôt pray for themselves with that kind of confidence because they are afraid of being disappointed.

It‚Äôs easy to pray general prayers to avoid disappointment. The Lord is looking for those who know they are servants of the Lord.

So Elijah went from there to pray for the drought he prophesied to end. Then he sends his servant 7 times to check on the clouds. Then he saw a cloud the size of the mans hand and they ran off the mountain because he knew that a small cloud could bring a mighty outpouring. But after that, his rubber band had been stretched with no chance to rest and he began to freak out when Jezebel determined to kill him.

Breakthroughs can cause you to compromise on your personal life, but don‚Äôt let them because it will suck you dry.

Sometimes the things that aren‚Äôt important are the most important things to do.

There was a pastor who left his office for 30min each day to go sit on a ridge in the city and watch the train because it was the only thing in town that wasn‚Äôt pushing something.

The stretching of your rubber band, wether for tragedy or great success after time will be emotionally exhausting. We must learn how to rest.

As the Lord entrusts his presence to you it becomes easy to abuse it.

What was so priceless once can become a part of so many other things. I tell our teams when they travel not to be distracted with their electronics because what can be a tool and is very important can also become the thing that pulls you away from what‚Äôs most important.

Don‚Äôt let the things that are dear become a problem.

Some of you have had the best and the most difficult circumstances of your lives in the past couple years and that‚Äôs important because it means that your life has been real. But many of you will be going out to create your own weather system in a place where there is not much of the Holy Spirit momentum already taking place.

How do you live without constantly evaluating how well you are doing?

We‚Äôve just had another season of tragic losses and great victories in my family. When you are navigating through all of that, how do you maintain a sense of pleasure and joy in everything you do? I don‚Äôt know any other way than to remain childlike and a worshiper before the Lord.

Our greatest temptation in worship can be to worship worship, to exalt the experience instead of him. That‚Äôs why tenderness before the Lord is so crucial. We need to be moved by something that He does.

His wonders must remain a wonder. I can‚Äôt afford to become familiar because that will make me careless.

In scripture the heart is portrayed as the soil that the seed is planted in. To have seed planted in soil it has to be tender.

James says ‚Äúin humility, receive the word implanted which is able to save your soul‚Äù

That which you receive will change you. Which really relieves us from a lot of pressure because none of us can change anything about us that is eternally significant.

I have a friend who every morning re-dedicates his life to the Lord.

How many of us have been in that tender place where we‚Äôve said ‚ÄúI will do anything‚Äù and meant it. But then you become accustomed to the lifestyle he‚Äôs brought you into and lose connection with the ‚ÄúI will do anything‚Äù.

I would like nothing more than to see in 20 years you remaining childlike, delighting in Him.

What does successful ministry look like to you? Your answer to that question will determine what could discourage you.

Ryan Hall made a statement. ‚ÄúThe world will tell you what success looks like, that‚Äôs not success. Success is doing everything God‚Äôs told us to do.‚Äù

It‚Äôs one thing to believe that as a concept, it‚Äôs another to walk through it and see if you‚Äôll be faithful through the losses.

God lead Israel into 3 battles. The first two they lost. (Judges) It seems strange, but somehow it prepared them for gratitude, dependency.. all the things he‚Äôs valued in our lives.

What would you tell your 30 year old self?

Don‚Äôt take yourself so seriously.

I was so hungry for what I wanted to see God do that I didn‚Äôt enjoy the journey or the process. You have to know how good he is and how pleasurable he is.

How do you keep from taking God‚Äôs presence for granted?

Always stay sacrificial.

The bible says to make sacrifices to God. The problem is that what was once a sacrifice to give later becomes easy, so your sacrifice has to grow with you. Not in a works sense, but in order to keep you on edge.

Don‚Äôt let your heart wander during worship. It‚Äôs for your sake. (honour the point)

How should we respond to the billion soul harvest?

When the Israelites approached Jericho, they walked around 7 times, shouted and the walls came down but the enemy was still there. Prayer removes the obstacles, but we still need to evangelize.

Prayer alone won‚Äôt accomplish it all, and evangelism without prayer is not wise. We need both.

How do we know which doors to take?

Look for the biblical allowance, the ability and the internal peace. God will open doors that he doesn‚Äôt want us to go through because he trusts us and wants to see if we will respond rightly.

Bill Johnson, April 23, 2013

Wisdom and Excellence

I drove here in a really nice car. Some people have asked me, do you deserve that car? And the answer is no, if I drove what I deserve I‚Äôd be walking everywhere.

Everything given to us is God‚Äôs grace.

When we think we deserve something, we will get all kinds of offended when we don‚Äôt get what we think we deserve.

You can‚Äôt be bought if you know everything is grace.

Everything God gives you is to be shared. Look for people to raise up and empower. The fulfillment of your life is found in the success of those around you.

I was talking to a missionary who had two cars and he drove the cheeper car to churches when he went to raise support because if he drove the nice car to church they wouldn‚Äôt give him very much.

I want to be a part of the process to expose wrong thinking, so I‚Äôd drive the nice car. There is thinking that sounds right, but it is religious.

If there is anything I want you to go out from here and do, is to think ‚ÄúWhat is kingdom‚Äù not asking public opinion.

Jesus had no place to lay his head but he had a seamless robe. He didn‚Äôt have everything but what he had was excellent.

Being of the kingdom demands expression.

As your authority and realm of influence increases, your opportunities to express excellence increase.

Perfectionism is religion, excellence is kingdom.

Honour comes out of a culture of excellence. This is how royalty treats royalty.

There are several things that are looking for expression in every human being. Morality is one of them. Every human being has to express morality. That‚Äôs how you can have mafia who kill anyone but are devoted to family. Everyone has something they must pour into to view their actions either as right or wrong.

Every person in this room has a God given need to express creativity. The problem is that we‚Äôve reduced creativity to common art forms. But it‚Äôs supposed to be expressed by how we do life.

Unity cannot be obtained through uniformity, it must be obtained through uniqueness and valuing one another.

Solomon made the world speechless because of his wisdom. It‚Äôs time that we did that, that some of the world will lose it‚Äôs voice. The queen of Sheba said ‚Äúit‚Äôs better to be a servant in your house than a king in mine‚Äù and she said ‚Äúhalf wasn‚Äôt told to me‚Äù. She came hoping to be impressed but not sure because what she had heard about him was so extreme, but when she got there he had so surpassed what she was hoping to run into that she was stunned.

Solomon is to become a prophetic prototype for this generation.

I want to see you as a generation called wisdom.

When she saw the plates, clothes and stairs she became breathless‚Ä¶ She was so overwhelmed by those things that the bible didn‚Äôt bother to mention the answers he gave to her questions. Wisdom has to be expressed through excellence, creativity and integrity.

Wisdom doesn‚Äôt just see the surface, it looks behind the facade and is mindful of the structures behind something. Wisdom is prophetic.

Wisdom gives you access to insight so that you can see beyond the obvious.

Solomon was able to capture the heart of this queen by how excellence, creativity and integrity touched the mundane parts of life: clothing, plates and stairs.

We aren‚Äôt talking about throwing money at something, we are talking about putting thought into something.

I want to stir up inside of you a passion to do things well.

I‚Äôd rather have a 2000 square foot house that is put together well than a 4000 square foot house that was just assembled. Or one really good pair of shoes than five mediocre ones.

I don‚Äôt want to show you what to value, but how to value.

ie. I will have a jet. The puzzle is that I know I will be challenged because people have problems with my decisions‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs been going on for years. Here is my dilemma. We have been given a limited number of days on the earth. We have been given a limited amount of strength. We have access to unlimited resource. Most ministries sacrifice what is limited to save what is unlimited. My point is not for you to buy anything. The issue is that I can spend 4 to 6 weeks more at home per year and get the same things done. I only have so much strength and so many days, why not tap into unlimited provision in order to improve what I can accomplish with the limited resources I have.

I grew up in an era where churches would go to shops and look to build what they needed with as limited resources as possible. But as christians we have access to unlimited resource, why not use it to bless the world and pay full price.

Don‚Äôt use opportunities to spend less for your benefit, represent God well and use your access to unlimited resource to bless people. Live from generosity. Learn the environment you are going to so that you can honour the culture you are visiting.

I‚Äôve been to many protocol leaders in the past years with the Chinese church and I‚Äôve gotten to meet with the leaders and I‚Äôve had to discover how to bless them. Try to be a person of excellence and treat them well.

I love going out to dinner with someone who has a lot of money and beat them to paying the check. Because when you have a lot of money, everyone expects to receive from you‚Ä¶ I want to be the opposite.

If you‚Äôre going into ministry, don‚Äôt use your title as a minister to go saying ‚ÄúI need‚Ä¶‚Äù

Bill Johnson, Tuesday March 12, 2013

Delivering the World from Sin

After a time of talking about San Francisco.

A city can only fall into sin to the measure it‚Äôs been called to greatness. The devil is not creative, he can only manipulate what exists.

Matthew 11:20

Jesus just revealed to us the key for sin filled cities. Miracles, signs and wonders could have transformed Sodom.

Miracles release glory.

John 2:11

If Capernaum was the city where the most miracles were done and glory is released in miracles, then logic would say that Capernaum was the most heaven-like city on the earth. But the faith there was not sufficient enough to sustain a habitation of heaven.

There is a difference between visitation and habitation. Visitation is much easier to get than habitation.

The miracle realm is very expensive.

Miracles signs and wonders are necessary to transform people and they release the glory of God to create an atmosphere of heaven.

These cities that are known for darkness are only displaying a counterfeit of what they are called to in light.

Because the devil is not creative, whenever we see a city in sin, that sin factor is only the counterfeit to what we would see in light.

The same is probably applicable about individuals.

My brother is a street minister in San Fran and he put his arm around one of his friends who is a drug dealer and said ‚ÄúYou know Carlos, one day you‚Äôre going to be preaching with me‚Äù and Carlos looked back and groaned ‚ÄúI know‚Äù.

Much of the church looks at a city like San Fran and believes that it needs to be judged.

But the fear of God is to draw men to him, not from him. People who truly fear God want to be with Him.

God calls us to administrate grace.

Unless you‚Äôre born again, you cannot see. This implies that if you are born again, you can see.

John 4 says lift up your eyes and look on the fields because they are all ripe for harvest. Jesus is saying that everyone is ripe.

There is an anointing equal to every person‚Äôs bondage and deception. In the same way that a cities sin is only a reflection of their potential, people are as ready to receive God now as they will be ever.

When the disciples got off the boat a man with 2000 demons comes running at Jesus. I doubt that any of the 12 thought this man was close to freedom. But Jesus carried an anointing greater than that man‚Äôs bondage. Then he was introduced into Christ‚Äôs one step program. (out of darkness into light)

The process that we have to use to get people free reveals the measure of anointing in which we live.

1 Corinthians 12

Pursue earnestly the things of God. Because they are not imparted at the revelation, they are made available then but you need the anointing for the impartation.

There is an incredible tension between what is in your account and what is in your possession.

You can sit and rev the engine to a 500hp car all day but you won‚Äôt move anywhere until the power of the engine is connected to the drive train. You have all authority in Christ but it‚Äôs faith that moves the power from the engine to the wheels.

There is an anointing available that makes everyone harvestable now.

So that‚Äôs what you do in the secret place, you cry out for the anointing that is equal or greater than the bondage that you see in the world around you.

Q&A

Is authority and anointing the same?

I look at them as different. I have unlimited authority that gives me access to unlimited anointing. Anointing is the Holy Spirit in his different flavors.

How do you continue going after greater things without getting disappointed?

I don‚Äôt think you can. I think learning to walk through disappointment that qualifies you to use grace and authenticity when you do get into a place of authority.

Jesus told us to heal the sick and raise the dead. Is it right for us to operate out of our own will when healing them?

First of all, it is always the will of God to heal sick people, but it may not be the most important priority for their life right now. So we have to operate out of presence.

But Jesus healed everyone who came to him. My approach is it‚Äôs always God‚Äôs will but I want to be sensitive to the HS to know how to do it.

Learn what the father is doing to bring healing to their life.

Side note: I always teach people to heal the sick, everyone needs to be healed. Then once that is happening, I train them to follow the guidance of the spirit to know who to heal. If I teach that message first, people won‚Äôt get rolling.

Could you give us advice on looking for internships?

I don‚Äôt think everyone is supposed to, but it‚Äôs a great opportunity to get into a system and culture and learn how it‚Äôs done in the practical.

A lot of the ministry done here is not actually healing the sick and raising the dead, it‚Äôs a lot of showing up and being faithful with everything.

Internships give you the opportunity to learn more about who you are and how you are equipped to serve and minister.

What is one of the reasons there is not more victorious living among christians today?

Often in america, caution has been called wisdom, not making a mistake is a supreme value, looking foolish is frowned on‚Ä¶

People need to let the spirit and the heart lead, not the head.

Faith requires taking risk.

Until that‚Äôs valued, we won‚Äôt get into what God has called us to be.

We read about John G Lake and how he spoke against the use of medical treatment. And I know that the view of this house is that medical attention is not a second class healing, but how can we reconcile the two?

Don‚Äôt try to display faith by not going to a doctor. Any effort to display faith will probably lead to presumption. But if I am called by God to seek him first, then I am walking in faith.

A boy once broke his arm during our service and I was asked to come pray for him

If someone comes to me and says ‚ÄúI‚Äôve heard from God not to seek medical attention‚Äù then I will join my faith to theirs. But if they ask me for advice, I will often pray with them and seek the lord on whether they should get a doctor‚Äôs advice. I never tell people what to do.

Bill Johnson, Tuesday March 5, 2013

The Language of the Spirit

God talks so different and english is not his first language, neither are any other worldly ones.

When you wake up in the morning, God always has something to say so we need to figure out how He is speaking. If we expect him to speak the way he did yesterday, we might miss what he‚Äôs saying.

I went through a period where I had to make a decision in two weeks and I was trying to make him talk. You really look stupid when you think you know how he is going to speak.

I‚Äôve been learning how he talks and it‚Äôs through many ways.

If I wait for the audible voice, I will die standing right here.

1 Corinthians 2:1

Paul had been ministering in Athens (Acts 17) and speaking with the philosophers of the day. (Paul‚Äôs sermon on Mars hill is one of the most studied sections of scripture by scholars).

We‚Äôve all had moments when we‚Äôve preached and for day after thought about how bad it was. This was Paul‚Äôs blue Monday, his time going from Athens to Corinth thinking about what he had just said. Paul was a genius, and he has had heavenly encounters that gives him insight to things that your average joe would be clueless about. But in Corinth he laid that all aside and chose to be dumb because he realized that the power he had forgotten to demonstrate in Athens would be more powerful than words.

Sometimes to minister in power, you‚Äôll have to say no to what you are good at.

There are times where functioning in your gift cancels out your ability to flow in power.

I‚Äôve had a number of times when in a teaching mode, a spirit of wisdom will come to me and I‚Äôll operate beyond a level of wisdom that I‚Äôve ever had before. Usually when that anointing comes, there is very little anointing for me to minister to the individual. Often the Lord will not release the miracles when you are operating in your giftings. Why? I think its because there are times in our life when we can‚Äôt be trusted with power and anointing together.

When God gives you power, don‚Äôt mess it up by displaying your gift.

So here Paul says, I so wanted you to experience the power of God that I didn‚Äôt do what I‚Äôm good at.

It‚Äôs not that we can‚Äôt do both, but don‚Äôt be surprised if you have one without the other.

The Lord is grooming us where he can trust us with personal anointing and giftings and then with power.

Don‚Äôt become convinced that your gifting is bringing the presence and the power.

Don‚Äôt tell anyone I said that, because I only think it‚Äôs true üôÇ

It‚Äôs not a hard and fast rule, because there have been times when both have come together, but it‚Äôs not guaranteed.

Don‚Äôt seek to look good in your gift.

1 Corinthians 2:4-

What you don‚Äôt know is as important as what we do know. If you know everything, you don‚Äôt need faith. We are called to walk in faith. It‚Äôs not called the walk of understanding.

If you want to understand everything, just get used to living in a very small world. If you want to live in a world without borders, learn to live in peace with mystery.

v8 The Lord played to the devil‚Äôs weakness to get him crucified.

v9 this verse has often been read at funerals which bothers me, because it‚Äôs not about eternity. Don‚Äôt read v9 without v10 because it says ‚Äúbut God has revealed to us by his spirit.‚Äù The spirit searches for the deep things, the things in verse 9 that has never been seen before. He is looking for things that will make us the generation of incredible wonders.

He is searching for things to encourage us.

‚ÄúHis thoughts of us outnumber the sand of the sea‚Äù‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs a whole lot. (Jeremiah 21:11) his thoughts are all good. So here we have God, who‚Äôs had a long time to think before anything was made, and he had you in mind as an individual, and his thoughts about you were powerful, creative, prophetic‚Ä¶ and they‚Äôve been going on for billions of years. The Holy Spirit is looking for those very thoughts that God has thought about you to bring you into the next level of your breakthrough. To encourage, give insight, strategy‚Ä¶ The Holy Spirit is doing this always for every one at once. He‚Äôs looking for the things that ‚Äúno eye has seen‚Ä¶‚Äù

Often times we prophecy off the surface, but the HS goes into the deep end.

The problem is that when the HS brings you one of those words, it‚Äôs hard to believe, because there is no logic to it.

v11 No one knows the God except the spirit of God, so the only way to find out is to ask the HS.

v12 HS is for a lot of things, one of those things is to help us know the unknowable.

In our hearts, we have AM and FM. When we have it on AM, we can quote all the scripture we want but if God is speaking on FM, we won‚Äôt hear what he‚Äôs saying. The natural man cannot receive what he‚Äôs saying, he doesn‚Äôt have a dial that goes far enough to hear what he‚Äôs saying. You have to actually change the way you hear from Him or you won‚Äôt hear his voice.

So he is constantly speaking correction, promise, encouragement‚Ä¶ but if I‚Äôm on AM, I won‚Äôt have the faith he‚Äôs giving me and won‚Äôt step into the destiny he has for me because I‚Äôm operating in the natural man.

God is spirit. He looks for those who worship in spirit. The HS has been given to us to connect us with him. Spirit doesn‚Äôt minister to natural man. The HS takes up residence in your spirit and your spirit begins to dictate to your body, emotions and mind. But the HS just speaks to your spirit.

So it comes down to (Romans 8:6) most obedience comes because you‚Äôve prepared yourself before the Lord spoke.

If I‚Äôm set on the flesh, I can‚Äôt minister life. So if I‚Äôm upset on the way into work, I have to confess to the Lord and repent, turn your heart to him, and then I can minister life. Don‚Äôt set yourself up for failure.

If God sends someone to you to give you a word of life, if your set on the flesh, you won‚Äôt be able to respond appropriately.

As a parent, if your kids have to stay up late for an event, you will probably lower the requirements you expect of them in the morning because you‚Äôve set them up to fail. Why? Because we want them to succeed, so we have to lower the requirements in order that they succeed.

When the Israelites were heading towards the promised land, there was an enemy army in the way. They were equipped to win the battle but they weren‚Äôt ready with confidence so He had them wait. He won‚Äôt take us into a battle that we aren‚Äôt equipped and ready to fight. A battle is not the right place to discover whether you are ready.

The heart that hears the voice of the Lord is humble and tender.

People sometimes become calloused because they have seen someone else abuse a gifting and they will disregard it.

When your heart is humble, you lean into the Lord.

God speaks to us in amazing ways. Sometimes he brings out little coincidences just to say He‚Äôs there and he‚Äôs proud of where you are. Don‚Äôt get intense and serious. Don‚Äôt try to decode, just let the breath of God waft across your heart.

When I went to Wales this year my room number was 308 and I thought, ‚Äúthat‚Äôs a good number, that‚Äôs the calibre of my rifle‚Äù. Then after a few days, we arrived at our next place and the room number again was 308, and I thought‚Ä¶ ‚ÄúI wonder what that means‚Äù but I didn‚Äôt know so I waited. Then in the morning I woke at 3:08 and thought ‚Äúok, what‚Äôs up?‚Äù and I didn‚Äôt hear anything.

Sometimes he wants to speak to us off the book. We don‚Äôt need to look at our book to see what the number might mean, sometimes he just wants to get our attention.

In Jeremiah, the ‚ÄúI see an almond branch‚Äù. The hebrew word for almond branch rhymes with the word for watching. It‚Äôs a riddle. God is saying I‚Äôm watching over you.

When you hide easter eggs for a two year old, you hide it in obvious places because the goal is for them to find it. When God speaks to us, it is for us to find things.

Later I remembered that I had asked the Lord 18 years ago for the chance to write and he spoke to me in the night and said ‚ÄúIsaiah 30:8‚Äù so when I got up, I read it and it said ‚Äúgo now and write‚Äù. God spoke to me in such an unusual way.

His presence and voice are the same.

Some people say they can feel God‚Äôs presence but they can‚Äôt hear his voice. They just need to adjust the dial because he‚Äôs speaking to us and communicating to our spirit.

The scripture doesn‚Äôt contain God and hold him in.

In Joel it says that when the spirit of the Lord would be poured out there would be dreams, prophecy and visions. It was quoted in Acts 2. But none of those things happened in Acts 2. We tend to look at the list of signs, but the HS said it was a perfect match. All the things in Joel 2 happened eventually. But the Holy Spirit said it was happening now.

God is not revealed in the list he is revealed in the nature of the list.

Moves of God come with different faces, but the same presence. So we need to learn to discern his presence not his face.

When Jesus walked with the two men on the road after the Resurrection, they didn‚Äôt recognize the face, but they felt the presence.

Bill Johnson, Wednesday February 13, 2013

How Jesus Healed

Mark 9:14-25

Why do you think the enemy put on such a scene? Intimidation‚Ä¶ it worked on the disciples.

‚Äúall things are possible to those who believe‚Äù

I love this story.

Jesus called the demon out before a crowd formed because he‚Äôs not a performer and he always redeemed people.

Jesus didn‚Äôt always forbid a return from the disease in the body. I wish I knew when it was right to do that.

A few times I‚Äôve been ministering to people and I could tell that they were so broken that I needed to draw a line so that the healing would be permanent, but not always.

Jesus didn‚Äôt let them build theology based on what didn‚Äôt happen.

He explained to them that the only way for healing to come in this case was through prayer and fasting, at that time he wasn‚Äôt praying or fasting though. We often fast into a problem, but Jesus didn‚Äôt, he fasted for 40 days to set himself into a higher realm of intimacy with God, and the overflow of that was that miracles became possible.

Jesus corrected low faith, but he was never withheld by it. He will speak to the position of the heart, not for shame but instead to teach them into a lifestyle that will open them to lasting change.

Jesus responded to every level of faith.

v17 the man said ‚ÄúI came to you for healing‚Ä¶‚Äù

I often have people come to me for healing, and I need to make sure that I‚Äôm directing them to Jesus.

When I come in before church on Sundays to pray over the room, I can see more with my eyes closed because when my eyes are open, what I‚Äôm ‚Äúseeing‚Äù is cutting down what I‚Äôm ‚Äúseeing‚Äù.

That‚Äôs why the demon threw the child on the ground, to distract Jesus from what he was seeing in the spirit.

Jesus knew to set his eyes on the Lord because the spirit of the Lord was upon him.
